channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023080923
item.description:
Report X-2023080923

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA Hazmat cage. During inspection it was found that the cap on the 5- gallon jug had failed to oporate. This caused a large amount of liquid to pour out of the plastic container. After the inspection was complete all contents within the package and jug were placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent vaper and liquid from causing further damage. DescribePack: The failure was caused by the cap failing to operate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I attempted to tighten the jug but failed to do so as the cap was night airtight, and you could hear air escaping the closure. Package and all contents were placed into a hazmat bag tightened closed and placed into a 20-gallon drum.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was showing internal leakage. package placed in black bin and moved aside. DescribePack: four liter bottle broken on inside due to insufficient packaging DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package moved in black bin and set aside for qa to clean up

item.title: Report X-2023080149
item.description:
Report X-2023080149

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought over to QA then was placed in a lined tote and prepped for processing at our hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package was brought over and there were giant holes on either side of the box due to the bottles inside leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box and bottles both placed in the bag to prevent leaking and any spillage was cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2023080087
item.description:
Report X-2023080087

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BELT MANAGER NOTICED A STAIN ON SIDE OF BOX SO WE OPENED AND INSPECTED. THERE WERE LOOSE CAPS ON ALL OF THE BOTTLES AND 1 OF THE BOTTLES RELEASED ABOUT 7 OUNCES OF LIQUID AND CONTAMINATED ALL 4 OF THE BOTTLES. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WE ISOLATED THIS PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE AND PUT UNDER THE HOOD VENT TO AIR OUT.

item.title: Report X-2023080082
item.description:
Report X-2023080082

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: WHITSETT
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package had been showing signs of internal leakage. package had been placed in a black bin and set aside so it would not damage any other packages in area. DescribePack: package had a loose cap and leaked out contents inside of the package DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was set in black bin and moved aside away from other packages.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pacakge was brought from our unloads area by one of our management team package started leaking while was being removed from the truck. DescribePack: The package itself showed no failure from the outside except the box itself was wet from the cracked bottle inside of it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I immediately placed the package inside of a lined tote to help prevent any more leaking in our building.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the ground wet from internal leakage. Package was then placed in salvage drum for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the inner contents cap was bent in/dented, causing leakage throughout the inner packaging. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed within a hazardous waste bag, and then into a hazmat salvage drum.

item.description:
Report X-2023071138

  • City: DURHAM

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZARDOUS MATERIALS TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS STAGING AREA AWAY FROM PERSONNEL AND OTHER PACKAGES. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS NOTED THAT THE CAP ONE OF THE PLASTIC CIDEHOL 70% ALCOHOL WAS A LOOSE CAUSING THE SPILLED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AFTER THE SORT ON 7/17. CORNER OF THE PKG WAS DISCOLORED. PKG WAS THEN SECURED SO IT COULD BE INVESTIGATED FURTHER. DescribePack: LOOKS LIKE THE PLASTIC TOP ON ONE OF THE 2 JUGS BROKE AT SOME POINT AND HALF THE CONTENTS INSIDE THE JUG LEAKED OUT. NO HOLES IN THE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS SECURED AND BOTTLES WERE PLACED UPRIGHT.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of floor break (un3266) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the poly inner 1 gallon bottle had released 0.5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
